intro: Oncoba laurentii, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, spherical inflorescences that appear in winter. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered together, creating a striking visual effect. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Oncoba laurentii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
